title: The subalgebras of diagonal and scalar matrices (extension)
content: In the following, alternative definitions for diagonal and scalar matrices are provided. These definitions define diagonal and scalar matrices as _extensible structures_, whereas the definitions ~ df-dmat and ~ df-scmat define diagonal and scalar matrices as _sets_.

blocks.name: cdmatalt
blocks.content: Alternative notation for the algebra of diagonal matrices.

blocks.name: cscmatalt
blocks.content: Alternative notation for the algebra of scalar matrices.

blocks.name: df-dmatalt
blocks.content: Define the set of n x n diagonal (square) matrices over a set (usually a ring) r, see definition in [Roman] p. 4 or Definition 3.12 in [Hefferon] p. 240. (Contributed by AV, 8-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-dmatalt(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  |- wceq(cdmatalt, cmpo(s0, s1, cfn, universe, csb(s2, co(cv(s0), cmat, cv(s1)), co(cv(s2), cress, crab(s3, cfv(cbs, cv(s2)), wral(s4, cv(s0), wral(s5, cv(s0), wi(wne(cv(s4), cv(s5)), wceq(co(cv(s4), cv(s3), cv(s5)), cfv(c0g, cv(s1)))))))))))
  -| diffss(s2, s4)
  -| diffss(s2, s5)
  -| diffss(s2, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s2)
  -| diffss(s1, s2)
  -| diffss(s4, s5)
  -| diffss(s3, s4)
  -| diffss(s0, s4)
  -| diffss(s1, s4)
  -| diffss(s3, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s5)
  -| diffss(s1, s5)
  -| diffss(s0, s3)
  -| diffss(s1, s3)
  -| diffss(s0, s1)
}

axiom df-dmatalt(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5) {
  ‚ä¢ DMatALT =(s0 ‚àà Fin, s1 ‚àà ùïå ‚Ü¶[(s0[Mat]s1)/ s2](s2[|`s]{ s3 ‚àà(Base ` s2)| ‚àÄ(s4 ‚àà s0, ‚àÄ(s5 ‚àà s0,(s4 ‚â† s5 ‚Üí(s4[s3]s5)=(0 ` s1))))}))
  ‚ä£ d(s2, s4)

  ‚ä£ d(s2, s3)

  ‚ä£ d(s1, s2)

  ‚ä£ d(s0, s4)

}

blocks.name: df-scmatalt
blocks.content: Define the algebra of n x n scalar matrices over a set (usually a ring) r, see definition in [Connell] p. 57: "A _scalar matrix_ is a diagonal matrix for which all the diagonal terms are equal, i.e., a matrix of the form cI_n". (Contributed by AV, 8-Dec-2019.)
blocks.origin:
axiom df-scmatalt(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3, setvar s4, setvar s5, setvar s6) {

thm dmatALTval(setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, class c0, class c1, class c2, class c3, class c4, class c5) {
  ‚ä¢ ((c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà ùïå)‚Üí c2 =(c3[|`s]{ s0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)= c5)))}))

} = {
  syl5eq(c2, (c3[|`s]{ s0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)= c5)))}), (c0[DMatALT]c1), (c0 ‚àà Fin ‚àß c1 ‚àà ùïå))

  eqtrd([(hs0[Mat]hs1)/ hs2](hs2[|`s]{ s0 ‚àà(Base ` hs2)| ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà hs0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà hs0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)=(0 ` hs1))))}), (c3[|`s]{ s0 ‚àà c4 | ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà c0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà c0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)= c5)))}), ((hs0[Mat]hs1)[|`s]{ s0 ‚àà(Base `(hs0[Mat]hs1))| ‚àÄ(s1 ‚àà hs0, ‚àÄ(s2 ‚àà hs0,(s1 ‚â† s2 ‚Üí(s1[s0]s2)=(0 ` hs1))))}), (hs0 = c0 ‚àß hs1 = c1))
